text.11_Chapter, 4_Verse, 0_Comment: you shall inquire after His dwelling – This is the tabernacle of Shilo
text.11_Chapter, 8_Verse, 2_Comment: to the resting place – this is Shiloh:
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 1_Comment: this good mountain: This is Jerusalem.
text.32_Chapter, 11_Verse, 3_Comment: and dwells between his shoulders -  The Holy Temple was built on the highest point of his land, except that it was twenty-three cubits below the Eitam Spring (see Yoma 31a).  David intended to build it there, as is taught in Shechitath Kodashim [Zev. 54b]: But they said to David ‘Let us build it a little lower, because it is written ‘and He dwells between his shoulders,’ and there is no part of an ox more beautiful than its shoulders.’
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 0_Comment: Pray let me cross over: The word נָא is nothing but an expression of request.
text.32_Chapter, 11_Verse, 2_Comment: all day long -  that is, forever. From the time Jerusalem was chosen, the Divine Presence has never dwelt elsewhere.
text.11_Chapter, 8_Verse, 0_Comment: For you have not – all those fourteen years (of conquest and inheritance):
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 2_Comment: and the Lebanon: This is the Holy Temple
